en.html: First select an area of science in which you would like to work
en.text: First select an area of science in which you would like to work

en.html: Now select a topic within the area {{$EFO_S_A?|name}}
en.text: Now select a topic within the area{{$EFO_S_A?|name}}

en.html: Now select a target variable for the topic{{$EFO_S_A?_T?|name}}
en.text: Now select a target variable for the topic{{$EFO_S_A?_T?|name}}

en.html: Click Next to continue or modify your selection before continuing
en.text: Click Next to continue or modify your selection before continuing

en.html: In this table, tap on the one variable that the question is testing in this experiment
en.text: In this table, tap on the one variable that the question is testing in this experiment

en.html: Actually, that is not the one variable that you are testing for this experiment. Please try again.
en.text: Actually, that is not the one variable that you are testing for this experiment. Please try again.

en.html: That’s right! You correctly identified the one variable you are testing for this experiment.
en.text: That’s right! You correctly identified the one variable you are testing for this experiment.

en.html: Now choose the {{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}} for each condition that will allow you to see if the, {{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}} affects the, {{$EFO_S_A?_T?|name}}
en.text: Now choose the{{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}}for each condition that will allow you to see if the,{{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}}affects the,{{$EFO_S_A?_T?|name}}

en.html: Actually, that is incorrect. Please try again.
en.text: Actually, that is incorrect. Please try again.

en.html: You’re right! The variable that you’re testing should be different for each condition. If the variable is different, you can compare and contrast the effects of the variable.
en.text: You’re right! The variable that you’re testing should be different for each condition. If the variable is different, you can compare and contrast the effects of the variable.

en.html: Now you must decide how to set up the other variables in this experiment. Let’s start with the {{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}}.  which values would you use for each condition in order to find out whether the {{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}} has an effect on the  {{$EFO_S_A?_T?|name}}
en.text: Now you must decide how to set up the other variables in this experiment. Let’s start with the{{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}}. which values would you use for each condition in order to find out whether the{{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}}has an effect on the{{$EFO_S_A?_T?|name}}

en.html: Now select which {{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}} you would use for each condition in order to find out whether the {{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}} has an effect on the  {{$EFO_S_A?_T?|name}}
en.text: Now select which{{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}}you would use for each condition in order to find out whether the{{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}}has an effect on the{{$EFO_S_A?_T?|name}}

en.html: Finally select which {{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}} you would use for each condition in order to find out whether the {{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}} has an effect on the  {{$EFO_S_A?_T?|name}}
en.text: Finally select which{{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}}you would use for each condition in order to find out whether the{{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}}has an effect on the{{$EFO_S_A?_T?|name}}

en.html: Actually, anything you’re not testing should be kept the same between the two conditions. Please correct the experiment.
en.text: Actually, anything you’re not testing should be kept the same between the two conditions. Please correct the experiment.

en.html: <emphasis level='strong'>You’re right!</emphasis> Anything you’re not testing should be kept the same between the two conditions.
en.text: You’re right! Anything you’re not testing should be kept the same between the two conditions.

en.html: You have set up a good experiment to find out whether the{{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}} affects the{{$EFO_S_A?_T?|name}}
en.text: You have set up a good experiment to find out whether the{{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}}affects the{{$EFO_S_A?_T?|name}}

en.html: The one variable you are testing is different across conditions.
en.text: The one variable you are testing is different across conditions.

en.html: And all other variables are the same across conditions. This way, only the {{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}} can cause any difference you find in the result.
en.text: And all other variables are the same across conditions. This way, only the{{$EFO_S_A?_T?_V?|name}}can cause any difference you find in the result.
Now we’ll look at how some other students have set up some experiments of their own for the topic of{{$EFO_S_A?_T?|name}}

en.html: Remember to THINK and work carefully so that TED can tell whether or not you need extra help. If you answer quickly and incorrectly, you will be asked more questions than if you answer carefully and correctly.
en.text: Remember to THINK and work carefully so that TED can tell whether or not you need extra help. If you answer quickly and incorrectly, you will be asked more questions than if you answer carefully and correctly.
Each experiment set up by some other students might either be a good or a bad experiment.
A 'good' experiment will let you figure out if the variable you are testing really does OR really does not make a difference. We will ask you if you think each experiment is a good or bad experiment.
